programme.title: Silent Night: A Song For the World
programme.desc: A musical film documentary about the cultural impact of the world's most famous Christmas carol. Composed in 1818 in Salzburg, and translated into 140 languages, Silent Night caused a Christmas ceasefire in World War I, while Bing Crosby's version is the third best-selling single ever. In short: A song for the world! The film tells the story of Silent Night, narrated by Hugh Bonneville, with new recordings by global stars in different languages.

programme.desc: When Bart ends up the only guest at Nelson's birthday party, the bully decides he's his best friend and goes about protecting Bart in a parody of "Goodfellas." Meanwhile, Homer reads Lisa to sleep and debates on whether to reveal the book's sad ending to her.

programme.desc: Homer jumps into a brawl during a holiday ice-skating show. To escape the melee, Marge takes the family Christmas shopping, where a chance encounter with Gil leads to bad luck for Gil and the Simpson clan. Elvis Stojko voices himself.

programme.title: Inventing the Christmas Prince

programme.title: My Southern Family Christmas

programme.title: Write Before Christmas

programme.desc: A man and an old high school friend try to sell his uncle's business -- a Mexican bakery that's famous for magical gingerbread cookies that grant wishes.

programme.title: Nantucket Noel
programme.desc: Christina finds out that a developer is planning on tearing down the wharf that is home to her toy store.

programme.title: Good Morning Christmas!
programme.desc: Two squabbling TV hosts are sent to a festive small town over Christmas. While pretending to get along for the sake of appearance, they discover that there's more to each other than they thought.

programme.title: Christmas Incorporated
programme.desc: A woman gets a job as a wealthy man's personal assistant through a case of mistaken identity, and she attempts to get her new boss not to shut down one of his factories right before Christmas.

programme.title: Noel Next Door
programme.desc: A hard-working, single mom gets into a war of words with an irritable neighbor who is ruining Christmas, only to find that this misunderstood Grinch is the man who's stolen her heart.

In Idaho, Kidd and Harry Youren lead a pack train of horses deep into the Sawtooth Mountains where they establish a wilderness fishing camp.

programme.title: Mountain Men

Martha and Elli Tansy travel to the coast to harvest clams and explore a different side of Elli's Native Alaskan roots. In North Carolina, Eustace Conway harvests the strongest wood to build new forges and upgrade Turtle Island's blacksmith shop.

programme.title: Mountain Men

programme.desc: An eccentric scientist builds a time machine, which accidentally transports a high-school student back to the 1950s, where the teen inadvertently interferes with the budding romance between his future parents. The boy must figure out how to set things right, or risk completely altering the future.

programme.title: Back to the Future Part II
programme.desc: A teen time-travels from 1985 to 2015 in order to save his parents and his children from the disasters precipitated by his own mistake when he traveled to 1955 and bought a book in order to enrich himself in the future.

programme.title: 2 Broke Girls
programme.desc: Max and Caroline return from their road trip, and Caroline is impressed with not only the dessert bar renovations but also with the contractor on the job. Meanwhile, Max rushes to see Randy when she learns he is in a New York City hospital; and Sophie joins a mommy group that cares less about baby talk and more about partying.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One Where No One's Ready
programme.desc: Nobody seems to be getting the message when Ross demands that the group get ready for his black-tie benefit. Monica: Courteney Cox. Ross: David Schwimmer.

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Monica turns her attention from making jam to maybe making a baby; Phoebe befriends a guy who's stalking her twin sister. Malcolm: David Arquette. Monica: Courteney Cox. Phoebe: Lisa Kudrow. Joey: Matt LeBlanc. Chandler: Matthew Perry.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One with the Metaphorical Tunnel
programme.desc: Chandler decides to make a real commitment to Janice; Phoebe poses as Joey's agent; Ross is troubled by Ben's toy. Mike Levey appears as himself. Carol: Jane Sibbett. Susan: Jessica Hecht. Janice: Maggie Wheeler. Ross: David Schwimmer. Phoebe: Lisa Kudrow. Joey: Matt LeBlanc.

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: The gang compiles "freebie lists"; Phoebe tries to get to know her half brother (Giovanni Ribisi); Joey builds an entertainment center. Isabella Rossellini appears as herself. Phoebe: Lisa Kudrow. Ross: David Schwimmer. Joey: Matt LeBlanc. Chandler: Matthew Perry. Monica: Courteney Cox. Rachel: Jennifer Aniston.

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: The show flashes back to when the friends were acquaintances and pairing off was a possibility. Chandler: Matthew Perry. Rachel: Jennifer Aniston. Monica: Courteney Cox. Phoebe: Lisa Kudrow. Ross: David Schwimmer.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One with the Race Car Bed
programme.desc: Monica orders a bed from the store owned by Janice's estranged husband; Joey teaches soap-opera acting; Ross struggles through a dinner with Rachel's abrasive father. Dr. Green: Ron Leibman. Janice: Maggie Wheeler. Joey: Matt LeBlanc. Ross: David Schwimmer.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One with the Giant Poking Device
programme.desc: Joey reveals to Chandler that he saw Janice kissing her estranged husband; Rachel and Monica baby-sit Ben; Phoebe explains her fear of the dentist. Janice: Maggie Wheeler. Phoebe: Lisa Kudrow. Monica: Courteney Cox. Joey: Matt LeBlanc.

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Ross and Monica go nose-to-nose in an unfriendly Thanksgiving football game. Margha: Susanna Voltaire. Ross: David Schwimmer. Monica: Courteney Cox. Chandler: Matthew Perry. Joey: Matt LeBlanc.

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Rachel quits Central Perk; Phoebe objects to the treatment of Christmas trees; Ross sells cookies for a "Brown Bird" scout he injured; Monica gets hooked on Mint Treasures. Mr. Kaplan Jr.: Shelley Berman. Sarah: Mae Whitman. Charla: Kyla Pratt. Gunther: James Michael Tyler. Rachel: Jennifer Aniston.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One Where Chandler Can't Remember Which Sister
programme.desc: A drunken Chandler has a liaison with one of Joey's sisters; a nice guy recommends Rachel for a job. Mark: Steven Eckholdt. Cookie: Alex Meneses. Nonna: Penny Santon. Mary Angela: Holly Gagnier. Mary Therese: Mimi Lieber. Rachel: Jennifer Aniston.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One with All the Jealousy
programme.desc: Ross is jealous of Mark; a romantic poet criticizes Monica in verse; Joey's a dancing fool for a Broadway musical audition. Mark: Steven Eckholdt. Rachel: Jennifer Aniston. Ross: David Schwimmer.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One Where Monica and Richard Are Just Friends
programme.desc: Monica sees Richard (Tom Selleck) again and they agree to be just pals---and occasional lovers; Phoebe's new beau has an embarrassing habit. Robert: Markus Flanagan. Joey: Matt LeBlanc. Rachel: Jennifer Aniston. Phoebe: Lisa Kudrow.

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.sub-title: Cape Canaveral, Schrödinger's Cat, and Cyndi Lauper's Hair
programme.desc: In an attempt to bond with Sheldon, George Sr. takes the boys on a road trip to see a space shuttle launch. Also, Mary, Missy and Meemaw have a girls' weekend at the salon.

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: George Sr. strikes a deal with Sheldon to tutor Georgie when poor grades threaten to keep him from playing football.

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.sub-title: An Eagle Feather, a String Bean and an Eskimo
programme.desc: When Sheldon moves to Dallas to attend a school for gifted children, the family struggles to cope with his absence.

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.sub-title: A Computer, a Plastic Pony, and a Case of Beer
programme.desc: Sheldon asks for a computer and unknowingly sparks a heated argument between Mary and George Sr. over the family's finances.

programme.title: The Importance of Being Earnest
programme.desc: Faithful version of Oscar Wilde's satire of manners, romance and mistaken identity. Michael Redgrave, Joan Greenwood, Margaret Rutherford, Dorothy Tutin, Michael Denison, Miles Malleson, Edith Evans. Directed by Anthony Asquith.

programme.title: Gaslight
programme.desc: Original version of Patrick Hamilton's Victorian melodrama about a fortune hunter's efforts to drive his wife mad. Anton Walbrook, Diana Wynyard, Frank Pettingell. Nancy: Cathleen Cordell. Vincent: Robert Newton. Cobb: Jimmy Hanley. Alice: Marie Wright. Directed by Thorold Dickinson.

programme.title: The Prime Minister
programme.desc: Drama of the rise of the young Benjamin Disraeli (John Gielgud) from novelist to Queen Victoria's prime minister. Mary Anne: Diana Wynyard. Queen Victoria: Fay Compton. Agitator: Will Fyffe. Lord Derby: Owen Nares. Gladstone: Stephen Murray. Princess Victoria: Pamela Standish. Lord Melbourne: Frederick Leister. Sir Robert: Nicholas Hannen. Thorold Dickinson directed.

programme.title: 49th Parallel
programme.desc: Survivors of a sunken Nazi submarine flee across Canada. Eric Portman, Laurence Olivier, Leslie Howard, Glynis Johns, Raymond Massey, Anton Walbrook. Michael Powell directed.

programme.title: Black Narcissus
programme.desc: Five Anglican nuns confront temptation in a remote Himalayan village in this visually stunning story.

programme.title: The Barefoot Contessa
programme.desc: The life of a beautiful peasant dancer turned popular actress unfolds via flashbacks recalled by mourners at her funeral, including the director whose career she saved, a press agent who witnessed her tumultuous relationship and her troubled husband whose wedding-night confession devastated her. Director Joseph L. Mankiewicz's screenplay was Oscar nominated.

programme.title: Mogambo
programme.desc: Remake of 1932's "Red Dust" is a saga of big-game hunting and romantic intrigue in Africa, where a raffish safari guide leads an expedition deep into the jungle and becomes the prey of an anthropologist's lustful wife. Clark Gable starred in both versions of the tale. Ava Gardner and Grace Kelly were nominated as Best Actress and Best Supporting Actress, respectively.

programme.title: Knights of the Round Table
programme.desc: A group of artists recreate the stories inspired by the adventures of Lancelot and Merlin.

programme.title: Bhowani Junction
programme.desc: An Anglo-Indian woman, searching for a sense of identity and community amid the turmoil and upheaval at the time of the English withdrawal, falls in love with a British officer .

programme.title: My Forbidden Past
programme.desc: A débutante falls for a common doctor, but her family disapproves of the match. When she eventually inherits their fortune, she makes another play for her lost love.

programme.title: Show Boat
programme.desc: Third version of the Jerome Kern-Oscar Hammerstein II musical about Mississippi riverboat life chronicles the problematic romance between the beautiful daughter of the ship's captain and a prodigious gambler.

programme.title: Lone Star
programme.desc: Clark Gable tries to ensure that Texas opts for statehood. Old-fashioned entertainment. Ava Gardner, Broderick Crawford, Lionel Barrymore. Minniver: Beulah Bondi. Anthony Demmett: Ed Begley.

programme.title: Ride, Vaquero
programme.desc: A settler and his bride fight to protect their land from two outlaws intent on running them out of the area.

programme.title: The Little Hut
programme.desc: A neglectful husband, a cheating wife, and her lover are all stranded together on fruit-tree filled but very small island after a shipwreck. With no worries about food, the three focus mainly on their love triangle.

programme.title: Parade Show
programme.desc: Featuring interviews with stars and clips of MGM films.

programme.title: I Died a Thousand Times
programme.desc: An aging bank robber is released from prison. He decides to pull one last robbery at a high-class mountain resort before retiring, and use some of the loot to pay for a young girl's surgery. Unfortunately the crime doesn't go as planned...

programme.title: Ocean's 11
programme.desc: Frank Sinatra, Dean Martin, Sammy Davis Jr. and the rest of the Rat Pack do it their way in the classic original version of the caper flick. Ol' Blue Eyes is Danny Ocean, a playboy who rounds up his old army buddies for a military-style heist in Vegas. The plan: Ring-a-ding in the New Year with a rip off of five casinos. Peter Lawford, Angie Dickinson, Richard Conte.

programme.title: The Thomas Crown Affair
programme.desc: Larceny mixes with romance in this caper film about a millionaire (Steve McQueen) who masterminds a bank heist for fun and then enters into a game of cat and mouse with the insurance investigator (Faye Dunaway) assigned the case. Michel Legrand's score was Oscar nominated, and the song "The Windmills of Your Mind" was named Best Song.

programme.title: Melody Cruise
programme.desc: Good songs and nice production numbers tied to a plot about a ladies' man (Phil Harris) and his escapades. Pete: Charles Ruggles. Laurie: Helen Mack. Ann: Greta Nissen. Hickey: Chick Chandler. Zoe: June Brewster. Mrs. Wells: Marjorie Gateson. Pleasant vintage entertainment. Mark Sandrich directed.

programme.title: Hooray for Love
programme.desc: A college kid and his reluctant muse try to make it big on Broadway with a glitzy revue, but their financial backer isn't as solvent as he seems.

programme.title: Music for Madame
programme.desc: A tenor (Nino Martini) is used as a front for thieves when he comes to Hollywood. Joan Fontaine. Nora: Lee Patrick. Rodowsky: Alan Mowbray. Flugelman: Alan Hale. Krauso: Billy Gilbert. Robinson: Grant Mitchell. Spaghetti: Erik Rhodes. Well-made. John Blystone directed.

programme.title: For the Love of Movies: The Story of American Film Criticism
programme.desc: Boston Phoenix critic Gerald Peary tells the story of film criticism in America. Included: remarks from Roger Ebert (Chicago Sun-Times), A.O. Scott (New York Times), Lisa Schwarzbaum (Entertainment Weekly) and Kenneth Turan (Los Angeles Times). Narrator: Patricia Clarkson.

programme.title: Heavenly Bodies
programme.desc: A dance instructor at a small studio contends with a rival health club and its unscrupulous owner by staging a televised dance-off.

programme.title: Gymkata
programme.desc: Olympic gymnast Kurt Thomas combines gymnastics and kung fu to rumble his way through a special mission as a Government agent. Princess: Tetchie Agbayani. Zamir: Richard Norton. Paley: Edward Bell. Gomez: John Barrett. Hao: Conan Lee. Thorg: Bob Schott.

programme.title: Summer Stock
programme.desc: Judy Garland and Gene Kelly team in this tuneful tale about a theatrical company that stages a summer production on a financially burdened New England farm, and the down-on-her-luck owner ends up becoming the leading lady of the show.

programme.title: How to Raise a Baby
programme.desc: Actor-humorist Robert Benchley stars in this comedy short, which examines the perils and pitfalls of bringing up a toddler. Directed by Roy Rowland.

programme.title: Imperial Delhi
programme.desc: "Traveltalks" heads to the Indian city of New Delhi and stops at historical sites such as the Tower of Victory and the Cathedral Mosque. There is also a visit to a marketplace, where ivory carvers exhibit their wares, and scenes of a wedding procession and a steeplechase. Narrated by James A. Fitzpatrick.

programme.title: Rio Grande Patrol
programme.desc: Two border guards (Tim Holt, Richard Martin) fight the smuggling of arms into Mexico. Sherry: Jane Nigh. Bragg: Douglas Fowley. Peppie: Cleo Moore. Trevino: Rick Vallin. Directed by Lesley Selander.

programme.title: The New Adventures of Tarzan: Operator No. 17 - Re-Cap Chapter
programme.desc: The jungle warrior Tarzan searches for his missing friend, while helping an officer search for a hidden treasure which becomes dangerous in the wrong hands.

programme.title: A Date With the Falcon
programme.desc: The suave sleuth postpones his honeymoon to pursue diamond thieves in the second entry in the crime series.

programme.title: The Last Installment
programme.desc: Convict Clyde Peeler (Cameron Mitchell) becomes enamored of a famous criminal while reading about the bad guy's legendary exploits. However, he learns a lesson when his idol goes to prison for life.

programme.title: Top Hat
programme.desc: Fred Astaire as a stage star, and Ginger Rogers as his beautiful neighbor, dance---and romance---from London to Venice in this tip-top musical full of classic Irving Berlin tunes. Astaire and Rogers' fourth of 10 screen pairings was nominated for Best Picture.

programme.title: The Long, Long Trailer
programme.desc: Real-life husband and wife Lucille Ball and Desi Arnaz play upwardly mobile honeymooners who decide to buy a "home on wheels" so they can live together while his job takes them around the country. Unfortunately, the joyride hits some bumps in the road.

programme.title: In the Good Old Summertime
programme.desc: Two clerks in a turn-of-the-20th-century Chicago sheet-music store are intensely antagonistic toward each other, but unbeknownst to the two, they actually are getting very chummy as pen pals. A musical remake of "The Shop Around the Corner," in which the setting was changed from a Budapest sundries shop.

programme.title: Decisiones
programme.desc: Una cuestión de dinero, llamado no por casualidad "el vil metal", hace estragos. Y termina complicando la vida de una pareja. Que guarda una bella historia detrás de su relación, que inició como la de muchos jóvenes enamorados. Sin embargo, cuando la obsesión por los bienes materiales se interpone al sentimiento, todo se echa a perder.

programme.title: Más sabe el Diablo
programme.desc: Un joven no sale de una vida de equivocaciones y el peor error aún está por venir, enamorarse de la mujer prohibida.

programme.desc: Un programa con un estilo único de narrar la noticias, de una manera atractiva y perspicaz. Este noticiero cuenta con la presentación de historias locales y nacionales en vivo, haciendo uso extensivo de elementos gráficos. Además, este noticiero...

programme.desc: Schwoz invents a vacuum to help Henry clean his house, but it accidentally sucks Charlotte inside. When Henry's family hears Charlotte, they think the vacuum is haunted. Ray must distract them while Henry finds a way to get her out.

programme.desc: A visitor who claims to be from the future visit Henry. Then, the team looks for a way to save everyone from disaster.
